sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with no solutions.
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations and determine if it has no solutions:

x + 2y - z = 5

2x - y + 3z = 12

3x + y - 5z = 1
message_2:
To solve this system of linear equations, we can use the method of substitution or elimination. Here, we will use the elimination method. 

First, let's eliminate y from the first two equations. Multiply the first equation by 2 and the second equation by 1 to make the coefficients of y equal:

(1) 2(x + 2y - z) = 2(5)
(2) 1(2x - y + 3z) = 1(12)

Which results in:

(1) 2x + 4y - 2z = 10
(2) 2x - y + 3z = 12

Now subtract equation (2) from equation (1):

(1) - (2): (2x + 4y - 2z) - (2x - y + 3z) = 10 - 12

This simplifies to:

5y - 5z = -2

Now divide by 5:

y - z = -2/5

Now we have a new equation (3):

(3) y - z = -2/5

Next, let's eliminate y from the second and third equations. Multiply the second equation by 3 and the third equation by 2 to make the coefficients of y equal:

(2) 3(2x - y + 3z) = 3(12)
(3) 2(3x + y - 5z) = 2(1)

Which results in:

(2) 6x - 3y + 9z = 36
(3) 6x + 2y - 10z = 2

Now add equation (2) and equation (3):

(2) + (3): (6x - 3y + 9z) + (6x + 2y - 10z) = 36 + 2

This simplifies to:

12x - z = 38

Now we have a new equation (4):

(4) 12x - z = 38

Now we have two equations with two variables (z and x):

(3) y - z = -2/5
(4) 12x - z = 38

Multiply equation (3) by -1 to make the coefficients of z equal:

(3) -1(y - z) = -1(-2/5)

Which results in:

(3) -y + z = 2/5

Now add equation (3) and equation (4):

(3) + (4): (-y + z) + (12x - z) = 2/5 + 38

This simplifies to:

12x - y = 192/5

Now we have a new equation (5):

(5) 12x - y = 192/5

Now we have two equations with two variables (y and x):

(5) 12x - y = 192/5
(1) x + 2y - z = 5

Multiply equation (1) by 12 to make the coefficients of x equal:

(1) 12(x + 2y - z) = 12(5)

Which results in:

(1) 12x + 24y - 12z = 60

Now subtract equation (5) from equation (1):

(1) - (5): (12x + 24y - 12z) - (12x - y) = 60 - 192/5

This simplifies to:

25y - 12z = -12/5

Now divide by 25:

y - (12/25)z = -12/125

Now we have a new equation (6):

(6) y - (12/25)z = -12/125

Now we have two equations with two variables (y and z):

(3) y - z = -2/5
(6) y - (12/25)z = -12/125

Multiply equation (6) by 25 to make the coefficients of y equal:

(6) 25(y - (12/25)z) = 25(-12/125)

Which results in:

(6) 25y - 12z = -60/5

Now subtract equation (3) from equation (6):

(6) - (3): (25y - 12z) - (y - z) = -60/5 - (-2/5)

This simplifies to:

24y - 11z = -50/5

Now divide by 24:

y - (11/24)z = -50/120

Now we have a new equation (7):

(7) y - (11/24)z = -50/120

Now we have two equations with two variables (y and z):

(3) y - z = -2/5
(7) y - (11/24)z = -50/120

Multiply equation (3) by 24 and equation (7) by -1 to make the coefficients of y equal:

(3) 24(y - z) = 24(-2/5)
(7) -1(y - (11/24)z) = -1(-50/120)

Which results in:

(3) 24y - 24z = -96/5
(7) -y + (11/24)z = 50/120

Now add equation (3) and equation (7):

(3) + (7): (24y - 24z) + (-y + (11/24)z) = -96/5 + 50/120

This simplifies to:

23y - (563/24)z = -142/15

Now divide by 23:

y - (563/552)z = -142/345

Now we have a new equation (8):

(8) y - (563/552)z = -142/345

Now we have two equations with two variables (y and z):

(3) y - z = -2/5
(8) y - (563/552)z = -142/345

Multiply equation (3) by 563 and equation (8) by 552 to make the coefficients of y equal:

(3) 563(y - z) = 563(-2/5)
(8) 552(y - (563/552)z) = 552(-142/345)

Which results in:

(3) 563y - 563z = -2252/5
(8) 552y - 563z = -142*552/345

Now add equation (3) and equation (8):

(3) + (8): (563y - 563z) + (552y - 563z) = -2252/5 - 142*552/345

This simplifies to:

1115y - 1126z = -2252/5 - 142*552/345

Now divide by 1115:

y - (1126/1115)z = (-2252/5 - 142*552/345)/1115

Now we have a new equation (9):

(9) y - (1126/1115)z = (-2252/5 - 142*552/345)/1115

Now we have two equations with two variables (y and z):

(3) y - z = -2/5
(9) y - (1126/1115)z = (-2252/5 - 142*552/345)/1115

Since the coefficients of y and z in both equations are not proportional, the system of linear equations has a unique solution.
